title: Circular capacitor set 2 - calculate charge on pla

content.question: If the plates have area <math alttext="A equals, 2.0 times 10 raised to the negative 4 power, meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></mstyle></math> and separation <math alttext="s equals, 1.0 times 10 raised to the negative 3 power, meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mstyle></math>, and the <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> of the source is <math alttext="script uppercase E equals 250 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>250</mn></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace></mstyle><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math>, what is the charge on one plate of the capacitor?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.8 times 10 to the negative 12 power, coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></math>

<math alttext="4.4 times 10 raised to the negative 10 power, coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></math>

<math alttext="2.2 times 10 raised to the negative 6 power, coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></math>

<math alttext="5.0 times 10 raised to the negative 2 power, coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4.4 times 10 raised to the negative 10 power, coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
